They loss me as a customer..  Extremely rude
Great pizza old school style
New Management.  Good Pizza :)

Been going to this pizza place for many years and have seen it change hands 4 times in the years that I have lived in the Bronx.  As the years went by and I moved out of the Bronx and I traveled from one end of America to the other.  Still having family around the corner. I always tried to stop by and eat a slice or 2.  Most of the time, I would order a pie and take my time eating it.  While the pizza was ok, it was'nt what I remembered.  A slice went from.25 cents to just under $3.00.  I also saw the Bronx Burn down, and rise from the ashes.  In the mean time this pizza place changed hands, I always stopped back and spoke to the guys that worked there.  In all of the years the place got darker and darker,with random drug sales out front and once or twice I witnessed a drug sale in the place while trying to finish my slice.  As far as the last owners, they did thier best to keep that outside.  But still the pizza was far better than most of the .99 cent pizza around the corner.  Just recently there are some new owners, they dont know the folks who live here.  When I am around, I try and stop by and either get a pie ir a slice or 2.  The last few times that I have stoped, the bottom of the whole pie was burnt and the last slice gave me horrible heart burn.  Yesterday, was the last straw, There was a new guy behind the counter, not wearing a mask or gloves, the person who was touching all of the pizza was not only not wearing gloves, but neither of the 2 people in the front had mask or gloves on.  When I asked them to please put on masks and gloves, the Knuckel head behind the counter got verbal as well as nasty.  I had to tell him to lower his voice when he talks to me. I told him that not only was I never ever going to step foot in there but that I was going to call the health dept on them.  His response was go ahead. Which believe me I did.  As I was leaving I noticed that there was no Letter Grading in The window.  No A, No B, No C, or even A Grade pending.  Which dont get me wrong, but its my understanding that this is a must for each and any food service place in all 5 boros.  The only thing that I can think of is that, the new owners fell that they can serve Black and Latino people garbage and dont have to follow and type of rules.  I"ll never ever step foot in there again and neither should you.  If you want a real NYC pizza place, drive, walk, up to Arthur Ave and stop by  Full Moon Pizza.  Best Pizza in the Bronx, wonderful owners, Clean,bathrooms, and decent prices.  Also please tell them Chef Eddie said hello.

NEVER ORDER!!!!!!!!! THEY DELIVERED MY PIZZA TO THE WRONG HOME AND REFUSED TO REFUND OR MAKE ANOTHER ORDER. THEY HUNG UP ON MY AND CALLED ME A LIAR. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED I HAVE GIVI=EN THEM BUSINESS FOR THE 10 YEARS I HAVE BEING LIVING HERE. THEY ARE RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL! THEY DO NOT UNDERSTAND CUSTOMER SERVICE. MY KIDS WERE WAITING ON THAT FOOD SMH. NNNEEEEEVVVEERRRRRR ORDERING FROM THEM THE FOOD ISNT THE BEST ANYWAY.
super place

Just left, New Owners are Rude and Nasty, Before this I had been going there for many years.  Will never go there again.  I asked the person who was touching the pizza to put on gloves, I was meet with they dont need to wear gloves.  Inside the place there were people standing around not wearing mask and not trying to social distance.  The person behind the counter started yelling at me, when I asked him to lower his voice he got even louder.  He also said that they didnt have to wear gloves,because he was the cashier and the pizzaman didnt have to wear gloves or a mask.  When I told him that I would call the Health dept. His response was go ahead.  I highly recommend staying away.

The food is delicious. The staff is very friendly,  welcoming and professional. I never have to wait long, food is always fresh and delicious, and the staff is always very nice and attentive.

Linda's pizza is delicious and the staff provide great customer service. They don't rush you out when you sit down to enjoy your food. I recommend this place for a good slice and they play good music too for those times you just need to chill and get out of your head for a while.

The pizza itself was okay but the service that I was met with  was terrible.  The person at the counter was rude and brash which is something I had not experienced when I visited there before.

This is my go to place when I want real Bronx pizza! They are so friendly and welcoming. Whether you are dining in or getting delivery it's always Amazing service and delicious, hot food.  The same delivery guy has been delivering my food for the past 11 years I have been living here and he always delivers with amazing service. And it is definitely a bang for your buck!

I went to this pizzeria with my granddaughter I waited on line I saw what I wanted it came my turn I said to the man I'd like that slice of white pizza and a slice of pepperoni he said that pizza is sold (mind you that now we are the only people in the store) I said that slice of pizza he said yes I got lasagna Pizza I got some other kind of pizza I said NO  if you sold a pizza why is it still sitting there on a tray for people to pick if they want to buy it he said it's sold long story short I walked out took my business somewhere else Thank You
